notes:
Hi 
No I am not part of an organisation. My complaint about the website and the
business they are attempting to conduct from it, is a personal complaint. If
that is what you need in order to launch an investigation, then please
regard this as a complaint.



 

Regards

Harry

Hi 


I appreciate the position you take in your response and the manner in which
it is expressed. I understand that the next step is for the website owner to
dispute the complaint.


I would like to draw your attention to the following. On the website
21gram.webnode.com hosted by your company, specifically on the
21gram.webnode.com/about-us/ page, the second paragraph on this page that
begins "21 Grams is a film from our Academy Award-nominated director of
Amores perros, Alejandro González Iñárritu..." and the complete body of text
that follows is directly taken from
www.focusfeatures.com/focusfeatures/film/21_grams/synopsis
which is in
direct contravention of sections 2.1, 2.2 and 2.6 of your website's terms
and conditions.


Regards
Harry

Dear 


Thanks for getting back to me. The operator of the website is still offering
tickets to the event and the promise of $530,000 for paying a registration
fee. I wrote to them again under a different name to see if they were still
operating the apparent scam. I have pasted below their latest email
responses received since last Friday. They have moved their operation to
another 
Wednode site
moviefocus.webnode.com/upcoming-event 
The plagiarized
content is included on their new website but they do not now claim to be the
producers of the particular movie.


 

Please do let me know how any further investigation by Webnode pans out.

messages.body:
Dear Kate


Before I register for your magnificent event I have a few questions. In your
email you say 'our management decided to give individuals opportunity to
attend this year red carpet occasion unlike previous edition' but on your
website you have a photo of a cheque for $530,000 being handed over to a
member of the public. So is this year's event really the first for
individuals or was it last year? Secondly, because of this photo, I wonder,
do I really get my money before the event or do I have to wait to be given a
large cheque at the event. And if I am given a large cheque how will I get
it home? Does it fold up into something small enough to pack in to a
suitcase. Or can I take it to a bank in Florida and deposit it? Will banks
in Florida accept oversize cheques. Banks in Australia have a policy of not
accepting oversize cheques any more because the bank tellers were getting
oversize paper cuts. One of them even lost an arm. So even if I did manage
to fold it up and pack it in my suitcase, it would be of no use to me in
Australia.


Sincerely
Harry Butkrak
Butkrak Enterprises

messages.body:
Harry,


It started last year, in last year edition people received their money at
the event and not before the event we did receive complain as not every
selected beneficiary was able to attend due to lack of finance so this year
we decided that any selected beneficiary will receive their funds before the
event date to enable the beneficiary pay for flight ticket and other
expenses that might be incurred during the cause of coming to the event. As
for the cheque do not be ridiculous the bogus cheque is printed for every
one to see there is a smaller cheque given and accepted by any bank
worldwide.


You have only 2 days to register for the event and pay the event
registration to enable you get the event confirmation receipt which you need
to present before you can receive your payment and also as gate pass for the
event.


Sign.
Kate Wilcox

messages.body:
Kate


Thank you for clearing up that misconception between your email and your
website. I am pleased to hear that the over size cheque is just for
publicity purposes. That is quite a relief. However now I am further
confused by another aspect. There are two methods of payment listed on the
form on your website. One is bank cheque which seems simple and
straightforward. The other is ATM. What is this and how does it work? In
Australia and the US, ATM are the machines in the wall outside banks and in
shopping centres that you put your card in, punch in your PIN number and it
gives you money from your bank account. How will the ATM option of payment
of the $530,000 work? Will you give me a bank card and a PIN number that I
can use in an ATM here and it will give me the money? Will the ATM machine
give me the whole amount at once? My bank in Australia only lets me take
$500 a day out of an ATM machine.


However I shall hurry and finish my registration now. Don't want to miss out
on the deadline! This is way too exciting.


Sincerely
Harry Butkrak
Butkrak Enterprises

HARRY BUTKRAK

messages.body:
Event Booking Team


If you are dealing with people all over the world, then you need to take
into account different time zones and different response rates available
depending on where someone lives. Western Union or Moneygram what's the
difference? You take the receipt along to an agent and get the money.
However if I can get a refund from the Moneygram agent tomorrow lunchtime I
will go to a Western Union agent and pay it there. I don't know where you
are, but I am in Australia. It's 7pm Thursday night now, so it will be 17
hours before I can go to the Moneygram agent and then a Western Union
office. Then I have to finish work, get home and scan the receipt and email
it to you. There's another 6 to 7 hours delay before my next email. That
adds up to around 24 hours or 1 day. There's another day wasted because
despite your operation producing films that cost millions of dollars you
can't even manage to find a local Moneygram agent to cash a couple of
hundred dollars.


Sincerely
Harry Butkrak
Butkrak Enterprises



 

cc: Kate Wilcox Gram Event

$US530m is fake and the registration fee is what is called advanced fee
fraud. It is clearly all fake because for the simple reason you had nothing
to do with the movie 21 Grams. It was made by Focus Features and you know
that because you plagiarised their website. The blurb about the movie is the
only decently worded English on your website. Don't bother sending the DVD,

reasons I know your website is fake that I could tell you about. However you
have been reported to Focus Features for plagiarism and to Webnode for

You are a scammer and I have great delight in telling you that I have

messages.body:
Hi Harry,

You mentioned that you have been engaging in scam baiting, are you part of
an organization targeting such sites? If so, please ensure that all future
correspondence regarding fraudulent websites are sent via your
organization's email account.


Webnode policy doesn't really allow us to block the mentioned website
immediately from such a complaint, our procedure for dealing with websites
is to give the user a limited time to respond to complaints from private
people, as you may be able to appreciate that sometimes not all claims of
abusive or fraudulent websites are genuine, and if this is the case, the
user is entitled to respond to accusations leveled against them. Usually
such disputes can be resolved between the two parties. However, in the cases
that you have brought to our attention actual scammers will not, and there
sites will therefore be blocked.


Complaints from the actual people or companies affected, legal authorities
or organizations, such as fraudwatchers.org are a different manner entirely.


We sincerely appreciate people bringing these sites to our attention, and we
are constantly evaluating our process for dealing with these issues and
creating a better structure for shutting down abusive or fraudulent
websites.


 Best regards,  , Webnode -- If you reply to this message, please
don't change the subject

authority having jurisdiction, or the holder of the copyright to request the
change be made to the content. I know this probably isn't what your looking

to work through our process and we will deal with the situation if the user
doesn't respond, or if he makes the changes.

it.

You were not selected in category of guest with no cash prize benefit so you
can not just automatically get your self into that category. The online
event registration ends 19th July 2010. If after this time you fail to
complete the event registration it means you are no more eligible to attend
the event or receive payments.


Mind your statements "We don't want to have to involve lawyers in this do
we?" we have every email sent to you documented if you can afford the
service of an attorney you should as well have been able to pay your event
registration fee. You were selected to attend the event and receive cash
prize benefits you can not just decide to change from this category and be
on the category of guest selected to attend the event with no cash prize
benefit just because you have decline the cash payment, what legal
documentation have you submitted to us to certify that you are declining the
amount? Did you request from us if we have process for that? You have no

or among the event organizing committee if you feel you have concise
knowledge of the law then you should have followed instruction given to you

registration payment we do not meet up then you could do what so ever
legally.


Do not try to be smart this is not your home affairs that you can run in any
manner you wish.

Event Booking Team

messages.body:
Dear Sir or Madam


I am currently cruising at an altitude of 35,000 feet above the Pacific,
lounging back in business class having enjoyed an exquisite four course meal
and a deeply tantalising merlot. My only attitude is one of bliss at this
moment in time.


The charming gentleman in the seat next to me has put me in touch with a Mr
Frank A Rubino in Miami. I have instructed him to send someone to purchase a
ticket on my behalf at one of the outlets listed on your website. Your
online registration may have closed, but Mr Rubino has advised me that over
the counter ticket sales in Florida are by law obliged to continue up until
2 minutes before any event starts. I am so looking forward to being at your
red carpet event.


The shades have been lowered so it is time to get some sleep before we land
at LAX and I make my connection.


Warmest regards
Sheila B Wright

messages.body:
Dear Sir or Madam


It is a glorious morning and promises to be a hot day in Miami. I am fully
refreshed after the long flights to get here and was all set to get hair and
make up done this morning in the hotel salon in preparation for the big red
carpet event today. Then I had a disappointing phone call from my attorney
Mr Frank Rubino. It seems that his staff had not been able to purchase a
ticket to your event at any of the outlets listed on your website. Further
enquiries to the Greater Miami Convention & Visitors Bureau revealed they
had absolutely no knowledge of your event. And if anyone knows what is going
on in Miami, I have been assured they do.


Then we decided to check online. Good heavens, both of your websites have
disappeared off the face of the earth. I asked Mr Rubino what could possibly
be going on with these good people who have spent $2 and 3 brain cells
designing a website and spamming thousands of people around the world with
the promise of half a million dollars for the outlay of a mere couple of
hundred bucks.


"Quite frankly my dear," Mr Rubino said to me, "I think these people are no
better than a hog-dog rodeo family." I had to Google that and it was not a
pretty sight.


I shall still keep my hair and make up appointment and after that it will be
time for morning tea. I think I will eat cake and lots of it.


Warmest regards
Sheila B Wright
